translated: As Said🔽
Itivuttaka🔽The Collection of Threes
The First Section
Craving

analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, said by the Arahant, so I have heard:
“Monks, there are these three kinds of craving.
What three?

analyzed: kāma taṇhā bhava taṇhā vibhava taṇhā
translated: Craving for sensuality, craving for becoming, craving for non-becoming.

original: imā kho, bhikkhave, tisso taṇhā”ti.🔽Etamatthaṁ bhagavā avoca.
analyzed: imāḥ kho bhikkhave tissaḥ taṇhā ti  etam attham bhagavān avoca
translated: These are the three kinds of craving.”🔽The Blessed One said this.
And in connection with this, it was said:
“Bound by the bond of craving,
their minds delighting in becoming & non-becoming,
they are bound by the bonds of Māra,
people who are not safe from bondage.
Beings go to birth & death
who go along with birth & death.
But those who, abandoning craving,
are free from craving for becoming & non-becoming,
they have gone beyond all bonds in the world,

original: ye pattā āsavakkhayan”ti.🔽Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: ye pattāḥ āsavakkhayanti  ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: those who have reached the ending of the effluents.”
This is the meaning the Blessed One spoke of, and in reference to this it was said.
